title._content: [Portrait of Joe Mooney, Gaeton (Gate) Frega, and Andy Fitzgerald, Dixon's Steak House(?), New York, N.Y., ca. Oct. 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Joe Mooney, Gaeton (Gate) Frega, and Andy Fitzgerald, Dixon's Steak House(?), New York, N.Y., ca. Oct. 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Chuckling visage on the cover, lensed by Bill Gottlieb, belongs to the squeeze box leader of the Joe Mooney Quartet which opens tonight at Dixon's, lush new NYC 52nd Street nightery. Reed-happy clarinet is Andy Fitzgerald, while Gaetan [Gaeton] Frega mans the bass. Jack Hotop's guitar neck should be in there somewhere too. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 234 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Joe Mooney on the cover," Down Beat, v. 13, no. 21 (Oct. 7, 1946). Subjects: Mooney, Joe, 1911-1975 Frega, Gaeton (Gate) Fitzgerald, Andy Joe Mooney Quartet Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Accordionists--1940-1950. Double bassists--1940-1950. Clarinetists--1940-1950. Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Cityscape photographs--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.06311 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 0631
